intro: Pacouria florida, commonly known as the Florida pacouria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Pacouria florida is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
